1950s.description: In the 1950s, magnetic drums and early forms of hard disks were used for storage in computers.

1960s.description: In the 1960s, storage was primarily tape-based, used in mainframe computers.

1970s.description: In the 1970s, floppy disks and magnetic tape were common storage mediums.

1980s.description: In the 1980s, hard drives became more prevalent in personal computers.

1990s.description: In the 1990s, optical disks like CDs and DVDs were widely used.

2000s.description: In the 2000s, flash memory and solid-state drives (SSD) started becoming popular.
